text: Alderman Samuel Gardiner MBE JP (born 24 March 1940) is a former Unionist politician in Northern Ireland for the Ulster Unionist Party and was a MLA for Upper Bann. Gardiner was elected to Lurgan Borough Council (now Craigavon Borough Council) in 1963 and held office of mayor in that borough in 1968. He was mayor of Craigavon 1982/3, 1988/9 and 2000/1. He was elected to the Northern Ireland Forum and was party whip in the same in 1996–1998. Gardiner was elected to the Assembly in 2003. He served on the Environmental, Leisure Services and Public Services Liaison Committees and was the UUP spokesperson on environment. As the oldest Northern Ireland Assembly member, Gardiner also served as Father of the House, a role which includes presiding over the election of a new Speaker of the Assembly. He was a former High Sheriff for County Armagh and was appointed as a justice of the peace. He was also a member of the Orange Order, "deputy Sovereign Grand Master" of the Royal Black Institution and former chairman of Glenavon F.C.. ==References== ==External links== * Profile on the UUP website * Stratagem profile * NI Assembly profile Category:1940 births Category:Living people Category:People from Lurgan Category:Members of the Order of the British Empire Category:Mayors of Craigavon Category:Ulster Unionist Party MLAs Category:Members of the Northern Ireland Forum Category:Northern Ireland MLAs 2003–2007 Category:Northern Ireland MLAs 2007–2011 Category:Northern Ireland MLAs 2011–2016 Category:British football chairmen and investors Category:High Sheriffs of Armagh
